titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lee Abbott Papers, circa 1965-2011 SPEC.RARE.CMS.0394
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ashleigh Minor

publicationstmt.publisher: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-03-19T11:01-0400

repository.corpname: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: As of 2018, Lee K. Abbott is professor emeritus of English at Ohio State University, and a writer of short stories, book reviews, and essays. He taught English at Case Western Reserve University from 1977 until 1989, and at Ohio State University from 1989 until his retirement in 2012. Abbott has published seven collections of his work. The Lee Abbott Papers contains drafts, proofs, and published copies of short stories, short story collections, book reviews, and essays written by Abbott. Also included are reviews of Abbott's work, and general articles and interviews about Abbott as a writer. Correspondence, materials related to his teaching activities, materials for speaking engagements in which he participated, and Abbott's typewriter and other personal materials are included as well. Materials are dated from circa 1965 to 2011.
did.physdesc: (15) 5" legal document boxes; (12) 5" letter document boxes; (3) oversize document boxes; (1) artifact; (1) 2.5" legal document box

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by: Lee K. Abbott, 2012 March

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Lee Abbott Papers, SPEC.RARE.CMS.0394, Rare Books and Manuscripts Library, Ohio State University

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in box 31 have restricted access and may not be viewed without prior curatorial consent. The remainder of this collection is available for patron research, but may be used only in the Thompson Library Special Collections reading room.

userestrict.head: Use of Materials
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be protected by copyright, and are made available for research and educational purposes. In general, the OSU Libraries do not own the copyright for materials from our collections and cannot grant copyright permissions for these materials. The user is responsible for making a final determination of copyright status. If copyright protection applies, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder to reuse, publish, or reproduce the work beyond the bounds of fair use or other exceptions to the law. Works in the public domain are not protected by copyright and do not require permission to use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Ashleigh Minor, 2018 March; finding aid written by: Ashleigh Minor, 2018 March

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: As of 2018, Lee K. Abbott (1947- ) is an American writer of short stories and professor emeritus of English at Ohio State University. He taught English at Case Western Reserve University from 1977 until 1989, when he began teaching at Ohio State University. Abbott was promoted to Humanities Distingushed Professor in 2007, and retired from Ohio State in 2012. Throughout his career he also taught as a writer in residence and a visiting faculty member at various academic institutions in the United States. Abbott's fiction has been published in literary journals and magazines, such as Harper's, The Atlantic Monthly, and The North American Review. He has published seven collections of his work, and his stories have been included in various other collections, including The Best American Short Stories. Abbott also reviewed books and works of other writers, and has written essays for newspaper and magazine columns. He has won fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts and the Ohio Arts Council, was nominated twice for the Pulitzer Prize, has received numerous writing awards, and was awarded the Alumni Distinguished Teaching Award in 2004 from the Ohio State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lee Abbott Papers contains drafts and published copies of short stories in literary journals and magazines, in addition to drafts, proofs, galleys, contracts, book covers, and copyright agreements for his short story collections. Reviews of Abbott's work, publicity for his collections, and articles about awards he won for his work are also included. The collection also contains book reviews and essays written by Abbott, as well as copies of the newspapers and magazines they were published in. Also included are copies of interview questions and responses, and correspondence between Abbott and his colleagues, students, publishers, and academic institutions. The collection also consists of materials related to Abbott's teaching activities, including clippings, letters of recommendation for students, evaluations of student work and colleagues' performance, and fliers, programs and notes for his workshops and lectures. Clippings, drafts of speeches, fliers, and programs for Abbott's various speaking engagements are included as well. The collection also contains some of Abbott's personal materials, such as his typewriter, his Minister license, drafts of speeches for eulogies and a wedding, and various newspapers, magazines, and clippings. Materials are dated from circa 1965 to 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in box 31 have restricted access and may not be viewed without prior curatorial consent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiction contains manuscript drafts of short stories, copies of literary journals and magazines in which the stories were published, tearsheets, and reviews of Abbott's stories. Also included are drafts, proofs, galleys, publisher contracts, book covers, copyright agreements, reviews and publicity for Abbott's short story collections. Articles related to awards Abbott won for his writing, articles about Abbott as a fiction writer, and interviews with him are also included. Materials are arranged alphabetically by title of the story or collection, and chronologically within each title. Untitled manuscripts are listed at the end of the manuscripts, and articles and interviews related to Abbott's work as a fiction writer in general are listed chronologically at the end of the series. Materials date from 1979 to 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reviews and Essays contains manuscript drafts of book reviews, essays, and literary journal reviews written by Abbott. Also included are copies of the newspapers and magazines in which his reviews and essays were published. Materials date from 1978 to 2009, and are arranged alphabetically by title of the review or essay, or title of the work being reviewed, with untitled and unidentified manuscripts listed at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence contains letters and emails with publishers, colleagues, fellow writers, students, and academic institutions. Personal correspondence is also included. The arrangement of the correspondence is separated into three groups created by Lee Abbott, and is maintained in this series: the first group is chronological by the date the letters were sent, with one undated folder at the end of this group; the second group is arranged alphabetically by first letter of the name of the correspondent; and the third group is arranged alphabetically by the full name of the correspondent, or first name of the correspondent when a full name is unknown. Materials date from 1977 to 2011.

did.unittitle: Roorbach (Bill); E. Gordon Gee; other Ohio State University colleagues

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in box 31 have restricted access and may not be viewed without prior curatorial consent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Teaching includes letters of recommendation for students, clippings about Abbott's faculty activities at Case Western Reserve University and Ohio State University, fliers and programs for workshops Abbott taught at, evaluations of student theses, evaluations of colleagues, and notes related to Abbott's lectures. Materials are dated between 1980 and 2011. Folder titles based on the topics of the contents within the folder and folder titles with student last names are interfiled and arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Case Western resignation for Ohio State University clipping
The Ohio State Lantern and Case Western campus newsletters

P&W Writers Exchange competition, faculty judge clipping

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Talks and Lectures contains fliers, clippings, programs, and drafts of speeches for Abbott's speaking engagements, including readings of his work, book talks, lectures, introductions for other speakers, and appearances at writing conferences, festivals, and forums. Materials are dated between 1981 and 2011, and are arranged chronologically by date of the event, with undated materials listed alphabetically at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal contains newspapers, magazines, clippings, materials related to Abbott's Minister license, drafts of speeches for eulogies and a wedding, articles that briefly quote Abbott, scraps of unidentified notes, copies of other writers' works, a copy of a book proof where Abbott's name is listed in the acknowledgements, and Abbott's typewriter. Materials are dated from circa 1965-1968, and 1984-2010, and are arranged alphabetically by folder titles based on the topics of the contents within the folder.
